name: Bad Guys Who Like to Loot and Plunder Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: A bodyguard of the one of the series' main baddies, this character has a military background and also works as a mercenary.
questions.explanation:
Argos Bleak.

	Bleak was featured as a "main" baddie in at least five episodes of the series, which was produced by Ted Turner.

questions.text: Originally voiced by Martin Sheen, this baddie was constantly trying to make a buck by cutting corners with his trash and toxic waste clean up activities.
questions.explanation:
Sly Sludge.

	After the first season Jim Cummings took over the voice acting duties for Sly Sludge. The character was a huge success in the toy line, but was rarely featured on the TV show.

questions.text: This villain has a massive scar on her face and is one of the main antagonists in the show. She is the sister of Bambi.
questions.explanation:
Doctor Blight.

	Blight was voiced by Meg Ryan on her first appearance and later by Mary Bergman. The character also was apparently dating her computer, MAL, throughout the series. This is evidenced by the way her tone of voice and personality change when dealing with it as opposed to other characters on the show.

questions.text: Looten Plunder was one of the baddest of the bad on the show. Looten was a nickname though - what was the character's given first name?
questions.explanation:
Gaben.

	Plunder is shown to care only about money throughout the show. He doesn't care for the well-being of anything, unless of course he can profit off of it. The character was voiced by James Coburn in the first three seasons.

questions.text: This character is similar to Nuclear Man from the fourth "Superman" movie, in that he is the exact opposite of the hero.
questions.explanation:
Captain Pollution.

	Only Captain Pollution was a character in the show. He had the power to absorb pollution and gain strength from it.

questions.text: This "Captain Planet" villain shares his name with a popular video game character.
questions.explanation:
Duke Nukem.

	Nukem is a giant yellow behemoth, with the ability to shoot pollution blasts from his fists. It was never revealed how his radioactive mutation occurred. He was voiced in the later seasons by voice over specialist Maurice LaMarche.

questions.text: This baddie was responsible for the death of Linka's cousin Boris. He also resembles a giant rat.
questions.explanation:
Verminous Skumm.

	He has the ability to control the rat population with his mind. After Jeff Goldblum left the show, Maurice LaMarche took over the role, making him responsible for multiple bad guys on the show.

questions.text: This character is the evil spirit of war and destruction. He was formerly the spirit of the Earth, before Gaia took over the job after he turned evil.
questions.explanation:
Zarm.

	During one episode he tricks the Planeteers into trading him their rings for more powerful ones, only to be eventually thwarted. He was voiced by Sting, David Warner, and Malcolm McDowell at various times during the show's run.

questions.text: The first villain that appeared on the show, his name fits well with his pig-like appearance.
questions.explanation:
Hoggish Greedly.

	This character was voiced by Ed Asner.  He descended from Don Porkaloin, who was seen in a flashback fighting one of the early groups of Planeteers. His son Hoggish Greedly Jr. also makes several appearances.

questions.text: He's another sidekick villain, but often the one doing the physical work for the plans to get underway. He has a long, thin nose and buck teeth.
questions.explanation:
Rigger.

	Rigger is voiced by John Ratzenberger. He often questions orders from Hoggish Greedly, but he always follows through on them.
